attributes.action: Protect citizens of Brunei against anti-LGBT laws
attributes.additional_details:
Other newly introduced measures by Sultan Hassanal include punishments that are in clear breach of human rights. These include:

-	amputation if found guilty of theft
-	a maximum penalty of death if found guilty of adultery, sodomy, robbery, insult or defamation of the Prophet Muhammad 
-	lesbian sex punishable by penalty of 40 strokes of the cane and/or up to 10 years in jail
-	public whipping for women who have abortions 

In some cases, these laws can be applied to children.
attributes.background: This petition is a call for the UK government to publicly condemn and put pressure on Brunei to revoke its anti LGBTQ+ laws that will see those in same sex relationships punishable by stoning to death.
